content:
Experimenting with different flavor combinations is a great way to discover new and exciting drinks. The lavender gin fizz sounds like a refreshing and unique cocktail, and I'm sure the lavender extract added a lovely floral note to the drink.

**Elderflower liqueur**
Elderflower liqueur is a great ingredient to work with, especially in spring-inspired cocktails. It has a delicate, floral flavor that pairs well with gin, lemon, and other botanicals. The combination of gin, lemon juice, and elderflower liqueur in the spring-inspired Collins at Harvest Kitchen sounds like a perfect blend of flavors.

**Farm-to-table restaurants and craft cocktails**
Farm-to-table restaurants like Harvest Kitchen are great places to explore unique and seasonal cocktails. They often feature menus that change with the seasons, which means you can try new and exciting flavor combinations throughout the year. Craft cocktails, in particular, are a great way to experience the creativity and expertise of the bartenders.

If you do end up trying the spring-inspired Collins at Harvest Kitchen, I'd love to hear your thoughts on it. And who knows, you might even get inspired to create your own spring-themed cocktails at home!

**Spring-inspired cocktails**
Speaking of spring-themed cocktails, have you considered experimenting with ingredients like rhubarb, strawberries, or honey in your drinks? These flavors are perfect for the season and can add a sweet and refreshing twist to your cocktails.

If you need some inspiration, I can definitely provide some spring-inspired cocktail recipes or ideas. Just let me know!
